meanings.definition: To accompany or guide someone from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: She was escorting her little brother to the park.
meanings.sent2: The security guard was busy escorting visitors around the museum.
meanings.sent3: The friendly dog insisted on escorting the mailman on his route every day.
meanings.sent4: The sun was escorting the moon across the sky as day turned into night.
meanings.sent5: The kind teacher always escorted her students safely to the bus stop after school.

meanings.definition: The act of accompanying or guiding someone from one place to another.
meanings.sent1: The escorting of the VIP guests was handled by the event coordinator.
meanings.sent2: The escorting of the students on the field trip was well-organized.
meanings.sent3: The escorting of the penguins by the zookeeper brought smiles to the visitors.
meanings.sent4: The escorting of the bride down the aisle was a beautiful moment.
meanings.sent5: The escorting of the lost child back to his parents was a heartwarming sight.
